channel.title: IP help, (Not port-forwarding)
channel.description:
Mk, so i didn't know what else to put the title as, but anyway, i'm wondering, how i could make my account only connect from my IP address is there anyway to do that?
Base: Project Insanity.
Thanks.

item.title: IP help, (Not port-forwarding)
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“XxJtxX, post:4, topic:393008”][code=java]
public void initialize() {

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("NAME")) {
	if (p.connectedFrom("127.0.0.1")) {
	} else {
		logout();
	}
}[/code]

Looks like it should work.[/quote]
I got it.

[code=java] public void initialize() {

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("NAME")) {
	if(lastConnectedFrom.equals("127.0.0.1")) {
		} else {
	logout();
	}
}[/code]

Thank you for the idea, on how to start the code.

EDIT: hah it works, really well.

Read full topic

item.title: IP help, (Not port-forwarding)
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“XxJtxX, post:2, topic:393008”]In the login method, make an if statement doing something like this:

if (username == “your user”) {
if (ip == “your ip”) {
} else {
disconnect
}

Please note, that this is just an example.[/quote]
Look right? [code=java]
public void initialize() {

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("NAME")) {
	p.connectedFrom("127.0.0.1")
		else
	logout();
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: IP help, (Not port-forwarding)
item.dc:creator: @XxJtxX XxJtxX
item.description:
@XxJtxX wrote:

In the login method, make an if statement doing something like this:

if (username == “your user”) {
if (ip == “your ip”) {
} else {
disconnect
}

Please note, that this is just an example.
